body_html: I get the idea of having uspecified output. However it is not metioned in the documentation of the topk. Can you also suggest me the better way of having top k elements without sorted (based on smallest index first)? Since topk also return indexes of the elements, I can sort the indexes and have it from the main vector. But it introduces extra overhead while I already have top k elements.

body: I get the idea of having uspecified output. However it is not metioned in the documentation of the `topk`. Can you also suggest me the better way of having top k elements without sorted (based on smallest index first)? Since `topk` also return indexes of the elements, I can sort the indexes and have it from the main _vector_. But it introduces extra overhead while I already have top k elements.
